intro: Turbina abutiloides, commonly known as the velvetleaf abutilion, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes in suitable climates.
